intro: Johrenia juncea, commonly known as the slender johrenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its rarity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
